intro: Mezilaurus palcazuensis, commonly known as the Peruvian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand dry conditions. Its flowering period usually occurs during the cooler months, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
